TextBlock.Text: ARCHIVIST: Signal transmitter online. This place will not be easily lost.
SCIENTIST: Then our journey is at an end. We've sent our spark upon the unknowable sea. All that remains is to wait - and to hope.
SCIENTIST: Our universe is cold but the experiences it contained will breath life into the next. May the Codec soon hurtle into a newborn universe, preserving the past and recording the future.
EXPLORER: I hope the next universe is different. More curious y'know. More willing to seek out knowledge amongst the stars, like we did.
ARCHIVIST: I hope they preserve our story. I fear that they will not - that we are but a dwindling specter of a forgotten people.
EXPLORER: I hope they cherish it. Maybe they'll tell it to each other around a campfire someday and it will remind them that the astral sea is not as lonely as it appears.
SCIENTIST: I hope that they will broaden it. Let it become the prologue of a saga stretching trillions of years across dozens of universes.

EXPLORER: One day, someone else will stand here in this place. They too will face the end of all they know. I hope they find this echo. I hope they take comfort in knowing that we came before, that they are not alone.
SCIENTIST: The time has come, friends. Shall we collapse the enumerable possibilities laid before us? A final coda to a dead universe.
EXPLORER: But more importantly, a prelude to what comes next.
